reviewText:
Dyna Bomb:

This is a damm addictive game. Good all round fun! I must say i got hooked from when i started my first game, the game is very easy to pick up and using a controller is recommended.
You have a Jet pack and your mission is to make your way through the puzzles to the exit and escape.
There is lots puzzles to keep you amuzed. You have to use Switches to turn off lasers , Teleports for the obvious , Keys to open the exits and there is also Gems to collect.
Each level is very similar but they add more twists each time to make it harder and keep you addicted to finishing each level. I think it was 8 worlds total and im only finished the first 2.

The game is very well built, i could not find any glitches in my time playing it. {Thumbs Up!}
I would recommend gamers who like this genre give it a go, it def' will not dissapoint.

Pros:
~ Good gameplay
~ Good graphics, Sounds

Cons:
~ Time will dissapear as you get hooked!

Overall: 8/10

reviewText:
Basic InformationTitle: Dyna Bomb
Genre: Action, Adventure, Casual, Indie
Developer: 7 Raven Studios
Publisher: OtakuMaker.com
Release Date: 13 May, 2016
General ImpressionDyna Bomb is a retro-arcade platformer game, which makes us to feel like we are in the mid 80’s. The graphics are retro, but for it’s type of games, which basically were in the begging of the video games industry, are well-designed. The textures are fairly alright. The atmosphere takes place in 8 different areas, each one of them having 8 levels, where they are getting bigger and bigger as the levels are increasing. The audio is well-chosen for this kind of genre. The music is pretty nice as well, it’s very suitable to the game. The gameplay is very simple: fly around the maps, collect a maximum of 3 stars, collect as many diamonds as possible for rewards, throw bombs at your enemies and don’t run out of ammunition very fast. You must reach the end of each level, you must get the required key to firstly open the gate, you also need to travel through portal,  which will lead you to certain places, the maps can get a little confusing because of many portals. The controls are badly optimized, even the mouse is not available, and the keys aren’t put well. You should change them like the following: W – flying up, A – flying left, D – flying right, R – throwing bombs. These are the controls that I used, they are enjoyable and easy-to-click. The engines are alright, I haven’t met any bugs, crashes, screen freezes or frame drops. This game works even with low-performant computers, as the store page says, making it accessible to any gamer. The mechanics are retro, they aren’t something complex. Everything moves on a definitive distance, and comes back in the same point. Overall, it’s a pretty nice game for those who are into retro games and not only.
Positive Points Pretty nice retro-style graphics
Pretty good SFX and soundtrack
Fun and relaxing gameplay
Many types of enemies and collectibles
Many levels to explore (around 64)
Colorful and diversified areas to explore
Portals make this game even more surprising
This game will make you to retry levels which you didn’t get 3 stars on, making it even longer
Many Steam trading cards available
Diamonds can offer you bonus improvements on the overall gameplay
Neutral Points Achievements would make this game more challenging
Multiple difficulties available would also improve the game
Negative Points The ammunition for bombs should be more at higher levels
The controls are not well-optimized, the mouse isn’t even programmable
General Ratings

reviewText: Dyna Bomb is a first game from indie developers 7 Raven Studios what was published in Steam (my congratulations!) and its  only 40 mb. There are 8 unique and different worlds with 8 levels in each of them, so 64 levels in total. You can choice between 2 heroes, but its just change color, blue or red. As game have word bomb" in name

reviewText: Do you remember Bomber Jack??? Well this game have some of that vibe but more slow. You have to pick up some Gems per level to complete the level. There are some extra challenges per level , the game mechanics are simple, you can fly and throw bombs to the enemys. You receive 1 hit and you die , so watch out or you have to redo the level thats the dificulty part. You can buy some power ups for the level in the store or play in the slot machine.\nOverall the game is not too long but enjoyable.

reviewText:
When i first booted up this game i thought it looked a bit like one of those casual kiddie games which wouldn't hold my interest for very long.
But the art style is pretty good actually and the game is fun to play.
Devs have made sure the controls work well before releasing on Steam ,you can also change the keys to whatever you are comfortable with.
I like the game mechanics which can be a bity deceptive at first as you think  oh this is easy" :)
You get to teleport across the screen/screens via portals to fetch items and also your P.C. has a rocket boost ability which seems to last as long as you want .
You chuck bombs to neutralise enemies
date:
though i think bombs are in short supply so don't waste them.
It starts getting a bit manic the more you play so it will be good for gamers who like a challange.

Overall it's a well made enjoyable game and definatly worth the asking price imho.
"

reviewText:
Product received for free

This is a 2d puzzle adventure, action game. Have many addictive things begining by his anime and humor art style toward his sound work. His controls of left-right arrow for movement, jump/jetpack and bomb make the game smooth. This game is very attractive it's looks as well as his gameplay. May require a slighty movement quick fingers and mind because there is limited time. Is perfect to kill some time playing a few hours anytime. It feels a game well done and complete without glitches or things that prevent play well. His framerate is very good and stable. there is a nicely anime background screen with sound but you can mute with more options around. Even in the main menu there is roll to gain one useful treasure/skill between them are seven. Each roll worth 1 x 200 gems each. Useful power ups are ready to use with your gems in game for complex or hard maps. Also you may choose between boy or girl player.

My experience playing some difficult maps I had to deal straightening the correct sequence to move forward as teleporters confuse you and you managing to where you go and where you come from. It's a bit difficult to explain until one plays himself and realizes. It is a game that looks simple but sometime may give you some hardwork. When collecting treasures around the map may you run out of time and die or just get killed because enemies come in unexpected places. I really like that each level that challenges you to play better. I would recommend this game 10/10.

reviewText:
I highly recommend this game. I've played a couple of hours and its very fun. But first, the trailer look pretty bad. It look like it run at 15-20fps, this game doesnt deserve a trailer like that. Hope the developer will fix this!
Because this game is really fluid and run very well~ (I wont run fraps for this one, but its a +60fps on my hd intel)
There is a least 10 differents languages, its an effort to notice.
At the beggining, tutorial is a bit invasive, a screenshoot with all the explanation should be a better way to explain the mechanism of the game.
dont forget to use the combinaison alt+tab to play fullscreen. (i've played windowed for a couple of round...)
The animation of the characters and ennemies are very well done, polished graphics.
Be patient and explore a bit and you'll find your way in no time (its not a very difficult platformer but you need to learn some level design.. yeah I've die a lot during the first couple of round..no shame in that ^^ )
tips: try to keep some bomb to avoid some bad situation! teleporter send you to some ennemies spot sometime!
Controls is pretty good and responsive. Another request: Add an option to play with a gamepad? And steam cloud to save game.

But for the price, this is a very good game~ hope you'll enjoy it!

reviewText: A full review of this I have posted up on Basedgamer.com, but a short version is the game is a lot of fun for the low price point. Despite a couple small glitches, the gameplay is solid, it offers a good challange that scales at a good pace, and a good amount of variety with it's eight worlds to play through. As long as you don't mind having no story in your game, it's a great way to kill some time.\n\nhttps://basedgamer.com/review/DynaBomb_2099_@TheMadMonarch

reviewText:
This game offers a very smooth gameplay experience. No jerky and glitchy movements,  and the framerate is high.

It also offers a great variety of languages to choose from after the splash screen load. The BGM and art is great too.

Controls can be changed to suit the player preferences but the default settings are:

Left and Right arrow for movement,
X to fly; and
Z to throw a bomb

There is a great variety of buffs/addons which you can purchase with the diamonds which are very helpful in the later levels as you might find yourself running out of time.

Be sure to keep an eye on the number of bombs you have left or else you might find yourself in a pinch!
